presenter.name: HJ Choi
presenter.title: Department of Internal Medicine SoonChunHyang University School of Medicine Bucheon and Seoul, KOREA
presenter.bio: Usefulness of EUS-guided sampling using core biopsy needle with onsite evaluation for diagnosis of metastatic liver mass

slide.title: Usefulness of EUS-guided sampling using core biopsy needle with onsite evaluation for diagnosis of metastatic liver mass
slide.titleNormalized: usefulness of eus-guided sampling using core biopsy needle with onsite evaluation for diagnosis of metastatic liver mass
slide.text:
Usefulness of EUS-guided sampling using core biopsy needle with onsite evaluation for diagnosis of metastatic liver mass HJ Choi, JH Moon, YN Lee, MH Choi, TH Lee, TH Lee, SW Cha, YD Cho, SH Park
Department of Internal Medicine SoonChunHyang University School of Medicine Bucheon and Seoul, KOREA

slide.title: BACKGROUND
slide.notes: Metastatic liver masses can be originated from various solid organ malignancies. And accurate diagnosis may be helpful for the guidance of adequate treatment.
slide.notesNormalized: metastatic liver masses can be originated from various solid organ malignancies. and accurate diagnosis may be helpful for the guidance of adequate treatment.
slide.notesHtml: Metastatic liver masses can be originated from various solid organ malignancies. And accurate diagnosis may be helpful for the guidance of adequate treatment.
slide.text: Histopathological diagnosis for metastatic liver masses A very common target of metastatic tumors Colon > pancreas > breast Optimal for deciding treatment From supportive care to partial hepatectomy Metastatic tumors with unknown primary site Identification of the site of origin may be helpful for the guidance of adequate treatment BACKGROUND DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL

slide.title: BACKGROUND
slide.notes: EUS-guided sampling for solid liver masses is feasible, safe and reliable modality in previous published studies. However, sufficient tissue acquisition is demanded for the confirmation of specific tumor type.
slide.notesNormalized: eus-guided sampling for solid liver masses is feasible, safe and reliable modality in previous published studies. however, sufficient tissue acquisition is demanded for the confirmation of specific tumor type.
slide.notesHtml: EUS-guided sampling for solid liver masses is feasible, safe and reliable modality in previous published studies. However, sufficient tissue acquisition is demanded for the confirmation of specific tumor type.
slide.text: EUS-guided sampling for metastatic solid liver mass Feasible, safe and reliable modality Diagnostic assessment and tissue sampling at the same time On-site evaluation for confirmation of malignant cells Helpful for rapid decision of treatment modality Demand of histologic evaluation by tissue acquisition For confirmation of specific tumor type BACKGROUND DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL

slide.title: BACKGROUND
slide.notes: As you know, ProCore needle has the reverse bevel side hole to acquire effectively core tissue during needle pass.
slide.notesNormalized: as you know, procore needle has the reverse bevel side hole to acquire effectively core tissue during needle pass.
slide.notesHtml: As you know, ProCore needle has the reverse bevel side hole to acquire effectively core tissue during needle pass.
slide.text: EUS-guided fine needle biopsy (EUS-FNB) Obtaining tissue core for histologic evaluation EchoTip ProCore® needle (Wilson-Cook medical, Winston-Salem, NC) Side hole at its tip for tissue acquisition during puncture BACKGROUND DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL

slide.title: AIM
slide.notes: The aim of this study is to evaluate the clinical usefulness of the EUS-guided fine needle biopsy with on-site evaluation for the diagnosis of metastatic solid liver masses.
slide.notesNormalized: the aim of this study is to evaluate the clinical usefulness of the eus-guided fine needle biopsy with on-site evaluation for the diagnosis of metastatic solid liver masses.
slide.notesHtml: The aim of this study is to evaluate the clinical usefulness of the EUS-guided fine needle biopsy with on-site evaluation for the diagnosis of metastatic solid liver masses.
slide.text: AIM To evaluate the clinical usefulness of EUS-guided fine needle biopsy with on-site evaluation for the diagnosis of metastatic solid liver masses DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL

slide.title: PATIENTS
slide.notes: We included patients with metastatic solid liver masses that was confirmed by prior imaging studies and needed to make accurate diagnosis for guiding management decision.
slide.notesNormalized: we included patients with metastatic solid liver masses that was confirmed by prior imaging studies and needed to make accurate diagnosis for guiding management decision.
slide.notesHtml: We included patients with metastatic solid liver masses that was confirmed by prior imaging studies and needed to make accurate diagnosis for guiding management decision.
slide.text: Study setting Study period: March 2012 – January 2014 Retrospective analysis of a prospectively maintained database Inclusion criteria Metastatic solid liver masses confirmed by imaging study (CT, MRI or EUS) Metastatic solid liver masses that were need to make accurate diagnosis for guiding management decision Exclusion criteria Inability to perform EUS-FNB: intervening blood vessels or altered GI anatomy Coagulopathy: INR > 1.8 or platelet count < 50,000/µL PATIENTS DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL

slide.title: PROCEDURES
slide.notes: EUS-FNB was performed with stylet, 15 to 20 movements with fanlike pattern, and 5 to 10 mL suction.
slide.notesNormalized: eus-fnb was performed with stylet, 15 to 20 movements with fanlike pattern, and 5 to 10 ml suction.
slide.notesHtml: EUS-FNB was performed with stylet, 15 to 20 movements with fanlike pattern, and 5 to 10 mL suction.
slide.text: Instruments Linear array echoendoscope: GF-UCT240 (Olympus) EUS-FNA biopsy needle 22G EchoTip ProCore (Cook Endoscopy) EUS-guided FNB Transgastric approach Puncture with stylet 15‒20 back-and-forth needle movements with fanlike pattern in the lesion 5‒10 mL of suction during sampling PROCEDURES DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL

slide.title: PROCEDURES
slide.notes: Acquired samples were divided into triple preparations, on-site, cytologic and histologic analysis.
slide.notesNormalized: acquired samples were divided into triple preparations, on-site, cytologic and histologic analysis.
slide.notesHtml: Acquired samples were divided into triple preparations, on-site, cytologic and histologic analysis.
slide.text: Triple sample preparation for one pass specimen PROCEDURES DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL On-site analysis Diff-Quick (Giemsa stain) Cytologic analysis Papanicolaou stain Histologic analysis H & E stain with IHC* *IHC, immunohistochemical stain

slide.title: ASSESSMENT
slide.notes: Definitions of assessments were like this.
slide.notesNormalized: definitions of assessments were like this.
slide.notesHtml: Definitions of assessments were like this.
slide.text: Classification of results On-site findings for malignancy Positive / Atypia / Negative / Nondiagnostic Cytologic and histologic findings for malignancy Positive / Suspicious / Atypia / Negative / Nondiagnostic Reference standards for malignancy Histopathological findings Clinical data including imaging studies following of greater than 6 months ASSESSMENT DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL

slide.title: CASE, Pancreatic Cancer with Liver Metastasis (54/F)
slide.titleNormalized: case, pancreatic cancer with liver metastasis (54/f)
slide.notes:
993279 김은희
A. CT showed a mass on left lobe of liver.
Let me show a case. CT scan showed a mass on the pancreas and the liver left lobe.

slide.text: CASE, Pancreatic Cancer with Liver Metastasis (54/F)

slide.title: CASE, Pancreatic Cancer with Liver Metastasis (54/F)
slide.titleNormalized: case, pancreatic cancer with liver metastasis (54/f)
slide.notes:
993279 김은희
EUS showed hypoechoic solid mass in left lobe of liver and EUS-FNB was done by 22G needle.
After confirming of intervening vessels, tissue sampling was performed with 22G needle.
slide.notesNormalized:
993279 김은희
eus showed hypoechoic solid mass in left lobe of liver and eus-fnb was done by 22g needle.
after confirming of intervening vessels, tissue sampling was performed with 22g needle.
slide.notesHtml:
993279 김은희

EUS showed hypoechoic solid mass in left lobe of liver and EUS-FNB was done by 22G needle.

After confirming of intervening vessels, tissue sampling was performed with 22G needle.
slide.text: CASE, Pancreatic Cancer with Liver Metastasis (54/F)

slide.title: CASE, Pancreatic Cancer with Liver Metastasis (54/F)
slide.titleNormalized: case, pancreatic cancer with liver metastasis (54/f)
slide.notes:
993279 김은희
Positivity for malignancy was confirmed by on-site analysis (Diff-Quick stain, X400) Cytological analysis revealed poorly differenciated adenocarcinoma (PAP, X400)
On-site evaluation revealed malignant cells. And cytologic result was cosistent with metastatic carcinoma.
slide.notesNormalized:
993279 김은희
positivity for malignancy was confirmed by on-site analysis (diff-quick stain, x400) cytological analysis revealed poorly differenciated adenocarcinoma (pap, x400)
on-site evaluation revealed malignant cells. and cytologic result was cosistent with metastatic carcinoma.
slide.notesHtml:
993279 김은희

Positivity for malignancy was confirmed by on-site analysis (Diff-Quick stain, X400)

Cytological analysis revealed poorly differenciated adenocarcinoma (PAP, X400)

On-site evaluation revealed malignant cells. And cytologic result was cosistent with metastatic carcinoma.
slide.text: CASE, Pancreatic Cancer with Liver Metastasis (54/F) On-site, Diff-Quick Stain Cytologic Evaluation Cytology, PAP Stain

slide.title: CASE, Pancreatic Cancer with Liver Metastasis (54/F)
slide.titleNormalized: case, pancreatic cancer with liver metastasis (54/f)
slide.notes:
993279 김은희
Small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma was diagnosed by histological analysis (H&E, X100, X400)
Histologic result was also consistent with poorly differentiated metastatic carcinoma.
slide.notesNormalized:
993279 김은희
small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma was diagnosed by histological analysis (h&e, x100, x400)
histologic result was also consistent with poorly differentiated metastatic carcinoma.
slide.notesHtml:
993279 김은희

Small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma was diagnosed by histological analysis (H&E, X100, X400)

Histologic result was also consistent with poorly differentiated metastatic carcinoma.
slide.text: CASE, Pancreatic Cancer with Liver Metastasis (54/F) Histologic Evaluation, H&E Stain x100 x400

slide.title: CASE, Pancreatic Cancer with Liver Metastasis (54/F)
slide.titleNormalized: case, pancreatic cancer with liver metastasis (54/f)
slide.notes:
993279 김은희
Immunohistochemical stainig shows positive for CD 56 and synaptophysin and negative for Chromogranin-A. The Ki-67 index was more than 20%.
Note: 1. CD56과 Synaptophysin 이 양성이라 neuroendocrine carcinoma 가 먼저 의심되나, osteoclast-like giaNt cell 이 많이 나오고 neuroendocrine carcinoma 의 핵의 특징적인 소견이 잘 관찰되지 않아 undifferentiated carcinoma with osteoclasit-like giant cells 의 가능성도 배제할 수 없습니다.
After immunohistochemical analysis, final diagnosis was metastatic undifferentiated carcinoma with osteoclast-like giant cells.
slide.notesNormalized:
993279 김은희

after immunohistochemical analysis, final diagnosis was metastatic undifferentiated carcinoma with osteoclast-like giant cells.

993279 김은희

Note: 1. CD56과 Synaptophysin 이 양성이라 neuroendocrine carcinoma 가 먼저 의심되나, osteoclast-like giaNt cell 이 많이 나오고 neuroendocrine carcinoma 의 핵의 특징적인 소견이 잘 관찰되지 않아 undifferentiated carcinoma with osteoclasit-like giant cells 의 가능성도 배제할 수 없습니다.

After immunohistochemical analysis, final diagnosis was metastatic undifferentiated carcinoma with osteoclast-like giant cells.
slide.text: CD56 CASE, Pancreatic Cancer with Liver Metastasis (54/F) Histologic Evaluation, Immunohistochemical Stains Synaptophysin Chromogranin-A Ki-67 Metastatic undifferentiated carcinoma with osteoclast-like giant cells

slide.title: RESULTS–1. Baseline Characteristics
slide.notes: Let me show study results. Total 25 patients undergone EUS-FNB for metastatic solid liver masses. Almost masses were located at left lobe. Most common diagnosis was pancreatic cancer.
slide.notesNormalized: let me show study results. total 25 patients undergone eus-fnb for metastatic solid liver masses. almost masses were located at left lobe. most common diagnosis was pancreatic cancer.
slide.notesHtml: Let me show study results. Total 25 patients undergone EUS-FNB for metastatic solid liver masses. Almost masses were located at left lobe. Most common diagnosis was pancreatic cancer.
slide.text: RESULTS–1. Baseline Characteristics Total number of patients 25 Age, mean±SD (range), years 64.8±15.0 (25‒87) Male / Female, n 9 / 12 Location of tumor, n Left lobe / Right lobe 24 / 1 Size of tumor, mm, n (%) Median (range) 31 (14‒70) < 20 8 (32.0) 20‒30 8 (32.0) > 30 9 (36.0) Final diagnosis, n (%) Pancreatic cancer 11 (44.0) Metastatic neuroendocrine tumor 5 (20.0) Colon cancer 3 (12.0) Stomach cancer 2 ( 8.0) Gallbladder cancer 2 ( 8.0) Ampulla of Vater cancer 2 ( 8.0) *SD, standard deviation DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL

slide.title: RESULTS–2. Technical Outcomes of EUS-FNB (n=34)
slide.notes: The median number of needle passes for diagnosis was 1 with interquartile range of 1 to 2. Acquired samples were adequate for cytohistologic evaluation 100%, 96%, 92% and 84% respectively.
slide.notesNormalized: the median number of needle passes for diagnosis was 1 with interquartile range of 1 to 2. acquired samples were adequate for cytohistologic evaluation 100%, 96%, 92% and 84% respectively.
slide.notesHtml: The median number of needle passes for diagnosis was 1 with interquartile range of 1 to 2. Acquired samples were adequate for cytohistologic evaluation 100%, 96%, 92% and 84% respectively.
slide.text: RESULTS–2. Technical Outcomes of EUS-FNB (n=34) Number of needle passes for diagnosis Median (range) 1.0 (1‒4) Interquartile range 1.0‒2.0 Technical success, n (%) 25 (100) Adequate specimen, n (%) On-site cytology 25 (100) Cytology with PAP stain 24 ( 96) Histology with H&E stain 23 ( 92) Histology with IHC stain 21 ( 84) Complications, n 0 ( 0) DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL

slide.title: RESULTS–3. Diagnostic Yield of EUS-FNB of Metastatic Solid Liver Mass for Malignancy (n=25)
slide.titleNormalized: results–3. diagnostic yield of eus-fnb of metastatic solid liver mass for malignancy (n=25)
slide.notes: Diagnostic yields for malignancy were 100% in on-site cytology, 92% in cytology and 84% in histology. Diagnostic accuracy for the specific tumor type was 80%.
slide.notesNormalized: diagnostic yields for malignancy were 100% in on-site cytology, 92% in cytology and 84% in histology. diagnostic accuracy for the specific tumor type was 80%.
slide.notesHtml: Diagnostic yields for malignancy were 100% in on-site cytology, 92% in cytology and 84% in histology. Diagnostic accuracy for the specific tumor type was 80%.
slide.text: RESULTS–3. Diagnostic Yield of EUS-FNB of Metastatic Solid Liver Mass for Malignancy (n=25) Positive for malignancy, n (%) On-site cytology 25 (100) Cytology with PAP stain 23 ( 92) Histology using H&E stain 21 ( 84) Overall diagnostic accuracy 100 for malignancy (%) Diagnostic accuracy 80 (64.3‒95.7) for specific tumor type, % (95% CI) *CI, confidential incidence DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL

slide.title: CONCLUSION
slide.notes: In conclusion, EUS-guided sampling for metastatic solid liver masses may be helpful in the management of patients who need to get a accurate histopathological diagnosis. Thank you for your attention.
slide.notesNormalized: in conclusion, eus-guided sampling for metastatic solid liver masses may be helpful in the management of patients who need to get a accurate histopathological diagnosis. thank you for your attention.
slide.notesHtml: In conclusion, EUS-guided sampling for metastatic solid liver masses may be helpful in the management of patients who need to get a accurate histopathological diagnosis. Thank you for your attention.
slide.text: CONCLUSION EUS-guided sampling for metastatic solid liver masses may be helpful in the management of patients who need to get a accurate histopathological diagnosis. DIGESTIVE DISEASE CENTER SOON CHUN HYANG UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL
